content: As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions. However, it is unlikely that Evangeline would be considered a strong female character in today's society. Modern concepts of femininity include traits like independence, assertiveness, and self-determination, which were not emphasized in Longfellow's portrayal of Evangeline. While she was dedicated, selfless, and resilient, it was mainly in service of her relationship with Gabriel, and she didn't have much agency or individual purpose beyond that. Therefore, by modern standards, Evangeline would likely be seen as a product of her time and an exemplar of traditional gender roles rather than a strong female character.
